author: charfdorn
title: A great start
review: If you happened to be 3 or 4 years old when this set was available, it was a great way to start a LEGO collection. I have two, somehow. You get a minifig and a good number of bricks in red, yellow, and blue, as well as some windows, wheels, and a door. Plus, you get a 16 x 16 baseplate. I have very fond memories of trying to build the alternate models to this set, which have the edges of bricks drawn in black - very helpful to a preschooler! I wish sets like this were just kept in circulation.

author: carlosfsm
title: My first set
review:
I'm having a big smile on my face right now that I can't get rid off.

This was my first set that introduced me to the LEGO world. It was very basic but it helped a lot to get my imagination flowing.

I remember to have built the different shapes and figures that the instructions suggested and then my parents saw that this was the best way to keep me busy and stop bothering them so they kept buying me more.

I'm 30 now and still keep all of my LEGO stored in a big plastic box for whenever I have a kid.

author: MADarchitect
title: Best start set.
review:
Box/Instructions

There are many basic models in different configurations to built.

Parts

A lot of basic building parts. It was quite big set for those times.

Minifigures

Only one driver minifigure. They were quite new in Lego world.

The completed model

Very easy set - a lot of fun for young Lego fans.

Overall opinion

One of the best starting sets I can imagine. These was my first set of Lego.
